unnormalised: **Environmental News: Mumbai's Waste Woes & a Promising Startup**
normalised: **Environmental News: Mumbai's Waste Woes and a Promising Startup**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – Handling Mumbai's mountain of garbage is a challenge as old as, well, maybe not *quite* 15/08/1947, but definitely a long time! The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is constantly battling the city's waste management problems, especially during the monsoon.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – Handling Mumbai's mountain of garbage is a challenge as old as, well, maybe not *quite* fifteenth august nineteen forty seven, but definitely a long time! The B M C is constantly battling the city's waste management problems, especially during the monsoon.

unnormalised: But there's a glimmer of hope! "Kachra Solutions," a startup founded by IIT-Bombay grad, Priya Sharma, is piloting a new waste segregation and processing system in Dharavi. They're using AI-powered sorting tech, aiming to reduce landfill waste by 60% within a year.
normalised: But there's a glimmer of hope! "Kachra Solutions," a startup founded by I I T-Bombay grad, Priya Sharma, is piloting a new waste segregation and processing system in Dharavi. They're using A I-powered sorting tech, aiming to reduce landfill waste by sixty percent within a year.

unnormalised: Initial reports are positive. Sharma says, "We're focusing on source segregation, educating residents, and incentivizing proper disposal. A clean Mumbai is everyone's responsibility, after all, like keeping your house clean during Diwali!"
normalised: Initial reports are positive. Sharma says, "We're focusing on source segregation, educating residents, and incentivizing proper disposal. A clean Mumbai is everyone's responsibility, after all, like keeping your house clean during Diwali!"

unnormalised: The project, slated to expand city-wide by 2024 if successful, received a boost with funding from the "Swachh Bharat Abhiyan" initiative. The next review meeting is scheduled for 09:00 hrs on 26/10/2023, so we'll be keeping a close eye on their progress. One can only hope that by 2030, Mumbai will finally have a handle on this monumental problem. Remember the three R's – Reduce, Reuse, Recycle!
normalised: The project, slated to expand city-wide by two thousand and twenty four if successful, received a boost with funding from the "Swachh Bharat Abhiyan" initiative. The next review meeting is scheduled for nine zero zero hours on twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty three, so we'll be keeping a close eye on their progress. One can only hope that by two thousand and thirty, Mumbai will finally have a handle on this monumental problem. Remember the three R's – Reduce, Reuse, Recycle!
